definition: to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
hot-selling property
lit. to sell hot food freshly cooked; fig. to teach what one has just learned/enthusiasm of the new convert
to sell while it's still hot (idiom); fig. in a great hurry to publish or sell (and no time to improve the product)

sentences.english: That was pretty hot production and try to build inventory of blanks.
sentences.chinese: 那绝对是非常热卖的产品，也詴图建立银币坯饼存货。

sentences.english: Scores of books have followed, selling millions of copies.
sentences.chinese: 海量的读物陆续出版，热卖多达上百万册。

sentences.english: It is a positive selling color in advertising and packaging.
sentences.chinese: 它是一个热卖的颜色在广告和包裹中。

sentences.english: An ultra-soft flocked puff for application of Select Sheer.
sentences.chinese: 超软热卖的必定粉扑的选择。

sentences.english: Our new books are selling like hot cakes.
sentences.chinese: 我们的新书正在热卖中。

sentences.english: This product is currently hot sold in Japan for man and woman market.
sentences.chinese: 目前在日本火辣辣热卖中之专攻男女市场产品。

sentences.english: But in China, also has is propagandized massively about the dwelling commodity and the sale.
sentences.chinese: 而在中国，也有大量关于宅的商品被宣传及热卖。

sentences.english: His books are all in print and selling as never before.
sentences.chinese: 他所有的书都在加印，以前所未有的速度热卖。

sentences.english: But curiosity alone wouldn't have resulted in the sale of 320, 000 books.
sentences.chinese: 可是，仅仅靠好奇心还不足以使这本书热卖32万本。

sentences.english: The frontpage showed the hot saled and promotional items which are not only wide but also bouniful.
sentences.chinese: 首页出现热卖及促销产品多且分类广。

definition: to sell well/hot-selling
to sell well/best seller/chart-topping
sales volume
to sell out/to run out (of supplies)/deficient/lack of supplies
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
to run out of (stock)
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
to hit the market (of a new product)
to have a sale/sale
advance sale/to sell in advance/to book
to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
hot-selling property
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to be completely sold out/to sell out
fiery (temper)/popular/flourishing/prosperous/lively
